intro: Hariota boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian hariota, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hariota boliviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
